titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Legal Records Relating to Sinclair Lewis
Legal Records Relating to Sinclair Lewis
titlestmt.author: by Susan Brady

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 05:50

did.unittitle: Legal Records Relating to Sinclair Lewis

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Legal Records Relating to Sinclair Lewis consist of records maintained by Mellville H. Cane, Pincus Berner, Paul Gitlin, Eugene Winick and other attorneys affiated with the law firm of Ernst, Cane and Berner and its later iterations. In addition to correspondence between Lewis and his attorneys, the records include drafts and copies of Sinclair Lewis's will; correspondence and documents concerning his death and estate; records regarding his writings, including contracts and agreements, and permissions and rights inquiries handled by attorneys after Lewis's death.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Wills and Estate Records, 1919-1982. II. Records Relating to Sinclair Lewis's Writings, 1935-1984. III. May 2017 Addition Regarding the Estate of Sinclair Lewis, 1927-1968.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Legal Records Relating to Sinclair Lewis is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, Inc. on the Sinclair Lewis Fund, 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Legal Records Relating to Sinclair Lewis. Yale Collection of American Literature.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Legal Records Relating to Sinclair Lewis consist of records maintained by Mellville H. Cane (executor of Lewis's estate), Pincus Berner, Paul Gitlin, Eugene Winick and other attorneys affiliated with the law firm of Ernst, Cane and Berner and its later iterations. In addition to correspondence between Lewis and his attorneys, the records include drafts and copies of Sinclair Lewis's will; correspondence and documents concerning his death and estate; records regarding his writings, including contracts and agreements, and permissions and rights inquiries handled by attorneys after Lewis's death. Also included is a photograph of Lewis and his wife, the journalist Dorothy Thompson (1893-1961), and photographs of an unidentified exhibition of Sinclair Lewis books and manuscripts. Additional records received in 2017 include legal and financial documents relating to the divorce of Sinclair Lewis and his first wife, Grace Hegger Lewis, and subsequent alimony issues, and correspondence relating to the publication of a biography of Lewis by Mark Schorer.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
The records were removed for preservation purposes from original accordion file folders maintained by attorneys. Labels and file numbers have been transcribed and included in the finding aid.

controlaccess.subject: Authors, American -- 20th Century

controlaccess.occupation: Lawyers -- New York (State) -- New York -- 20th Century

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in subseries based on file names and numbers assigned by attorneys.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, drafts and copies of wills; documents relating to Lewis's death; records relating to Thorvale Farm, Lewis's home in Williamstown, Massachusetts; estate tax proceedings and probate papers; income tax records; photographs; a script of a stage play written by Henry S. Bloomgarden and Malcolm Wells about Lewis and his second wife Dorothy Thompson, and correspondence regarding the script.

did.unittitle: Melville H. Crane and Sinclair Lewis correspondence
Copies of wills and notes regarding changes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence between Sinclair Lewis, Melville H. Crane, and Sanborn G. Tenney.

did.unittitle: Plaza Art Galleries sale of estate
Thorvale Farm sales brochures, postcards and maps
Thorvale Farm map and house plans
Estate Tax Proceedings and Probate Papers (9864)
Plaza Art Galleries sale of estate
Academy of Arts and Letters exhibition lists
Sinclair Lewis Estate ("Dorothy and Red" Play) (9323)
Correspondence, typescript photocopy of script, "Dorothy and Red" by Henry S. Bloomgarden and Malcolm Wells,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photograph of Sinclair Lewis and Dorothy Thompson and unidentified photograph of an exhibition of Sinclair Lewis books and manuscripts.

did.unittitle: Records Relating to Sinclair Lewis Writings

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged by title of work and file number assigned by attorneys.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, contracts and agreements, and permissions and rights inquiries related to Sinclair Lewis's writings. The Man from Main Street was a collection of non-fiction articles by Sinclair Lewis edited by Melville H. Cane and Harry E. Maule, published by Random House in 1953.

did.unittitle: Melville H. Crane editorial notes, lists, and introduction to volume
"Pieces agreed upon," sample dust jacket, and photostatic copy of "Self-Conscious America" by Sinclair Lewis from the American Mercury , October, 1925
May 2017 Addition Regarding the Estate of Sinclair Lewis

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in subseries based on file names and numbers assigned by attorneys.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, legal and financial records relating to the divorce of Sinclair Lewis and Grace Hegger Lewis; the biography of Sinclair Lewis by Mark Schorer; and financial records relating to bank accounts and securities.

did.unittitle: "Grace H. Lewis v. S. Lewis (papers only)" (5691)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes legal and financial documents relating to the divorce of Sinclair Lewis and Grace Hegger Lewis, and subsequent alimony issues

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence between McGraw-Hill Book Company, Inc., attorneys Melville Cane and Pincus Berner, and author Mark Schorer, and other material relating to the writing and publication of Schorer's biography, Sinclair Lewis, an American Life (New York: McGraw-Hill, c1961)

did.unittitle: "Sinclair Lewis at Home: 1942" by Mark Schorer
Requests for permission to publish photographs from Schorer biography
Correspondence between Edward C. Aswell and Sinclair Lewis

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typed copies of letters from Lewis to Edward C. Aswell regarding book recommendations

did.unittitle: Dividend and interest reports and securities and credit advises

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Guaranty Trust Company of New York deposit passbook (1951-1960)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cover letter and television script adaptation of Sinclair Lewis's World So Wide by Arnold Schulman

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous notes, legal and financial dcouments, and newspaper and magazine clippings concerning Sinclair Lewis
